description: If you’re the President of the United States and you don’t like a law, you can apparently just… decide not to enforce it for a while? I mean, it’s not supposed to work that way, but for the past 74 days, that’s exactly what’s happened with the TikTok ban. Not just ignoring it quietly — […]
title: Who Knew You Could Press A Snooze Button On The Law? Trump Delays TikTok Ban Enforcement Again

description: Healthcare.gov, the government health insurance marketplace website, launched in October 2013 only to buckle under the weight of just 2,000 simultaneous users. As millions of Americans stared at error messages and frozen screens, a political crisis unfolded, but so did a new era of government technology. The result was 18F, an in-house digital services consulting agency that […]
title: How 18F Transformed Government Technology − And Why Its Elimination Matters

description: The measles outbreak that began in Texas continues at a brisk pace. title: Amid The Measles Outbreak, HHS Cuts 1/8th Of Workforce

description: Trump has always considered cops to be better people than regular people. Unless they’re defending a federal building under attack by Trump’s people. title: Trump’s DOJ Civil Rights Division Finally Finds A Civil Right Worth Protecting

description: If you think back to Brendan Carr’s first tenure as a regular Commissioner at the FCC, he was constantly warning about “FCC overreach.” We couldn’t have privacy rules or net neutrality rules protecting consumers from Comcast, he said, because that would be an extremist abuse of government authority. title: Trump Earlobe Nibbler Brendan Carr Faces Inquiry Into His Broad Abuse Of FCC Power

description: We chronicled the implosion of the company Nikola and the fall from grace of its CEO, Trevor Milton, for years. title: Trevor Milton Lists All Of The Cozy Relationships With Trump That Definitely Didn’t Lead To His Pardon
